headline: Solar Shares Rise as Trump Hit to Credits Softer Than Feared
summary: Residential solar systems still will be able to qualify under prior guidance and the new rules won’t be applied retroactively.  Larger projects will be limited to a standard that requires a certain amount of physical construction to qualify for the credits.  “This is much better than expected,” said Phil Shen, a clean energy analyst with Roth Capital Partners, who added the changes were minimal overall.

raw.headline: Solar Shares Rise as Trump Hit to Credits Softer Than Feared

Larger projects will be limited to a standard that requires a certain amount of physical construction to qualify for the credits.  “This is much better than expected,” said Phil Shen, a clean energy analyst with Roth Capital Partners, who added the changes were minimal overall.

headline: Solar stocks surge after Treasury tightens clean energy tax credit rules
summary: Investing.com -- Solar and renewable energy stocks rallied sharply Friday after the U.S. Treasury Department and IRS released new guidance on clean energy project construction requirements for tax credit qualification.

raw.headline: Solar stocks surge after Treasury tightens clean energy tax credit rules
